page.description: Pastes copied controls from the clipboard onto the current or separate UX component.

discussion.p: To copy controls, first use the '[Copy selected controls to clipboard]' option. If you want to duplicate a control in a UX Component, use the '[Duplicate selected controls]' tool instead.

When controls are pasted from the clipboard, they can pasted *[ui:[before]Before selected control(s)]* or *[ui:[after]After selected control(s)]*. For more control over what is pasted, use the *[ui:Special...]* option.

section.title: Paste Controls onto a Component Using the "Special..." Option

description.p: After controls have been copied to the clipboard using the [Copy selected controls to clipboard] tool, they can be pasted into a UX Component. The *[ui:Special...]* option can be used to have more control over what is pasted.

step.description: Use the '[Copy selected controls to clipboard]' option to copy a set of controls to the clipboard.
Open a new component in the UX Builder. On the UX Controls page click the *[ui:Menu[menu]]* dropdown in the toolbar. Select the *[ui:Paste controls from clipboard]* > *[ui:Special...]*.
Select where you want to paste the controls in the controls tree and click the *[ui:Paste from Clipboard]* button.
The control will be added to the new component.
